author: Odeinoichus
title: Great for play, not much else.
review:
Set #30035 Off-Road Racer 2: I’m a sucker for a good Polybag, sometimes though good is subjective, and while I do enjoy certain things others can be hit or miss. Let’s discuss this set in the pros and cons and then give an overall opinion.

Pros:

  • Fun little model for the younger set, fast to build and great fun to race around with friends.

  • At the time of release very good price-per-piece ratio.

Cons:

  • Design is simplistic and relies too heavily on plates in my opinion.

  • Pieces not too unique or useful for MOCs.

Overall opinion

I suspect that this came out at a time where Polybags were not always designed consistently, it’s also from the LEGO Racers Theme, and from what I’ve seen most of those Polybags are designed to be simple, fun builds easy to assemble and race with, perhaps sacrificing some of the design for better playability.

Overall I enjoy the set for what it is, and it is nice to have it, however I’d only recommend this one for children. The build technique isn’t very exciting and it is primarily designed to be a toy first and foremost a display piece very minimally. For the younger set definitely enjoy and track it down if you can. AFOLs can steer clear of it, unless they happen to collect Polybags and are OCD in that regard.
